thread.title: Manchester United hold memorial ceremony for victims of Munich air disaster prior to match against Watford
thread.title_full: Manchester United hold memorial ceremony for victims of Munich air disaster prior to match against Watford

author: James Whaling
title: Manchester United hold memorial ceremony for victims of Munich air disaster prior to match against Watford
text:
Sport Manchester United hold memorial ceremony for victims of Munich air disaster prior to match against Watford Fans gathered outside the Theatre of Dreams before kick-off to pay their respects to the 23 people that lost their lives on February 6 1958 Share Fans pay their respects at Old Trafford (Photo: Getty Images) Share Get Manchester United FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Manchester United held a memorial ceremony for the victims of the Munich air disaster prior to their Premier League match against Watford on Saturday afternoon. 
Fans gathered outside the Theatre of Dreams before kick-off to pay their respects to the 23 people that lost their lives on February 6 1958. 
A minute's silence was also observed inside the ground and United's players wore black armbands for the 90 minutes. 
Eight United players lost their lives in the crash, including Duncan Edwards who passed away 15 days later in hospital. A fans holds a scarf remembering the victims (Photo: PA) Supporters gather at Old Trafford (Photo: REUTERS) The Munich memorial (Photo: Getty Images) 
Three further members of staff at Old Trafford were also among the fatalities as well as two crew members, eight journalists and two other passengers. 
Nine players survived, as did legendary manager Sir Matt Busby. 
A service was held at United's stadium on the 59th anniversary of the disaster earlier this week with the match against Watford the closest game to the date. Fans remember the Munich victims inside the ground (Photo: PA) Supporters fly flags in memory of the Busby Babes (Photo: Man Utd via Getty) Read More The Manchester United players who died in the crash Roger Byrne (28)
